  3. Ben Vorlich (Loch Earn)

Ben Vorlich (Loch Earn)

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Ben Vorlich above Loch Earn is one of the best-known Scottish mountains and is very popular. Close to the Highland boundary, it gives excellent views into the Lowlands.

 You have not climbed Ben Vorlich (Loch Earn).

Region: Perthshire

Altitude: 985 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.34/5
Rating: 3.3/5 (245 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Ben Vorlich and Stuc a' Chroin from Ardvorlich

Other routes and challenges

For a more straightforward route, the ascent to Ben Vorlich above could be followed to the summit before returning the same way - omitting the trickier Stuc a' Chroin.

Other options include approaching up Glen Ample and heading up to the Bealach an Dubh-Chorein, approaching from the head of Glen Artney, or a route from the south via Arivurichardich and Stuc a Chroin.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Perthshire Hotels

Perthshire B&B

Perthshire Cottages

Perthshire Hostels
